alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Webster (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 04 at 9:15PM CDT until July 04 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM CDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Nebraska, including the following counties, Franklin and Webster. * WHEN...Until 315 AM CDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 912 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Oak Creek, Liberty Creek, Thompson Creek, Little Blue River, Elm Creek, Rock Creek, Little Cottonwood Creek, Big Cottonwood Creek, Walnut Creek, Willow Creek, Crooked Creek, Turkey Creek, Beaver Creek, Ash Creek, and Lost Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Franklin, Blue Hill, Campbell, Bladen, Naponee, Bloomington, Riverton, Cowles, Inavale and Rosemont.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
